issue.title: Problem: Cannot download from Suunto Stinger
issue.body:
<!-- Lines like this one are comments and will not be shown in the final output. -->
<!-- If you are a collaborator, please add labels and assign other collaborators for a review. -->

### Describe the issue:
<!-- Replace [ ] with [x] to select options. -->
- [ X] Bug
- [ ] Change request
- [ ] New feature request
- [ ] Discussion request

### Issue long description:
Tried to download from a Suunto Stinger using a third-party usb interface adapter.
The adapter is recognised but no dives are listed or downloaded.

### Operating system:
Android 13
Moto  Edge 30 Fusion

### Subsurface version:
3.4.7 (5.0.9.35)
Official release

### Steps to reproduce:
Plug in usb adapter it is recognised.
Put Stinger into Transfer-PC mode.
Open Subsurface and the Suunto Stinger can be selected in the dropdown menus.
 
### Current behavior:
Initiate the download but no dives are listed.
They cannot be downloaded.
Eventually the Stinger times-out.

### Expected behavior:
Iit should list the dives as  normal so they can be downloaded.

### Additional information:
<!-- If a simple dive log file can reproduce the issue, please attach that to the report. -->
<!-- With dive computer download issues consider adding Subsurface log file and Subsurface dumpfile to the report. -->

### Mentions:
<!-- Mention users that you want to review your issue with @<user-name>. Leave empty if not sure. -->

comment.body:
My friend reports that the LEDs flash:
    RED/GREEN/RED/GREEN
i.e. two of each colour then nothing.

Information about the cable may be found here:
https://en.smartinterface.de/artikel.php?id=39&kat=1

For the Stinger+Android this indicates that the cable is only compatible with s/w called "DiveMate".

User downloaded this app and tried an import.
This worked (with much LED flashing). He could view the dives in this app.

What this seems to show is that the Stinger, USB OTG cable and Android are ok.

pull_request.title: Update comment on Qt6 destruction of StatsView
pull_request.body:
<!-- Lines like this one are comments and will not be shown in the final output. -->
<!-- Make sure that you have read the "Contributing" section of the README and also the notes in CodingStyle. -->
<!-- If you are a collaborator, please add labels and assign other collaborators for a review. -->

### Describe the pull request:
<!-- Replace [ ] with [x] to select options. -->
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] Functional change
- [ ] New feature
- [x] Code cleanup
- [ ] Build system change
- [ ] Documentation change
- [ ] Language translation

### Pull request long description:
<!-- Describe your pull request in detail. -->
Explain why Qt6 destroys our StatsView. I hope this is not too aggressive, but it really annoys me. In particular, it stops progress on the profile-to-QtQuick project. For the stats it seems to work, but I am not sure the profile is happy when the view is constantly destroyed. There, the connection between widget and view is much more convoluted.

@dirkhh: please check.

comment.body: I have a SmartInterface cable as well. They use a run of the mill FTDI chip. If that isn't supported what is? Does the LED on the cable blink in red or green? Can you send the Subsurface log file?

comment.body:
The cable works with a laptop and Subsurface and data can be downloaded.

With the mobile version, the serial number of the Stinger is correctly reported, so some communication is working. This suggests that the serial chip in the adapter cable is handled, at least partly.

issue.title: Current sources fail to compile
issue.body:
<!-- Lines like this one are comments and will not be shown in the final output. -->
<!-- If you are a collaborator, please add labels and assign other collaborators for a review. -->

### Describe the issue:
<!-- Replace [ ] with [x] to select options. -->
- [ X] Bug
- [ ] Change request
- [ ] New feature request
- [ ] Discussion request

### Issue long description:
<!-- Describe the issue in detail. -->

The sources that were downloaded just some minutes ago (by the yay git component) are not compileable

.../subsurface-git/src/subsurface/core/configuredivecomputerthreads.cpp:2221:46: error: too many arguments to function ‘dc_status_t hw_ostc3_device_fwupdate(dc_device_t*, const char*)’
 2221 |                 rc = **hw_ostc3_device_fwupdate**(m_data->device, qPrintable(m_fileName), m_forceUpdate);
      |                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
In file included from ....cache/yay/subsurface-git/src/subsurface/core/configuredivecomputerthreads.cpp:4:
/usr/include/libdivecomputer/hw_ostc3.h:58:1: note: declared here
   58 | **hw_ostc3_device_fwupdate** (dc_device_t *abstract, const char *filename);
      | ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


### Operating system:
<!-- What OS are you running, including OS version and the language that you are running in -->
<!-- What device are you using? -->
<!-- Only answer this question if you have tried: Does the same happen on another OS? -->

Arch linux, up to date
6.5.3-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Wed, 13 Sep 2023 08:37:40 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux
gcc version 13.2.1 20230801 (GCC) 

### Subsurface version:
<!-- What version of Subsurface are you running? -->
<!-- Does the same happen on another Subsurface version? -->
<!-- Are you using official release, test build, or compiled yourself? -->
<!-- Provide Git hash if your are building Subsurface yourself. -->

It should be the latest 


### Steps to reproduce:
<!-- Provide reproduction steps separated with new lines - 1), 2), 3)... -->

See the cmake, the package builder did in
https://aur.archlinux.org/cgit/aur.git/tree/PKGBUILD?h=subsurface-git

### Current behavior:
<!-- What is the current behavior? -->

see error message above

### Expected behavior:
<!-- What is the expected behavior? -->

I expect the sources that are downloaded here to be compileable

### Additional information:
<!-- If a simple dive log file can reproduce the issue, please attach that to the report. -->
<!-- With dive computer download issues consider adding Subsurface log file and Subsurface dumpfile to the report. -->

### Mentions:
<!-- Mention users that you want to review your issue with @<user-name>. Leave empty if not sure. -->

comment.body:
Ok, the problem was caused by a non-updated subsurface-libdc-git package.
Not really sure, why the package system hasn't updated that package when I requested so.

The only point that is remaining now is that at startup, subsurface claims

**The server returned the following information:
["You are running an unknown product version 5.0.10.234, latest released version is 5.0.10.223"]**

but I guess that's not so bad at all.

issue.title: Problem: Cannot download from Suunto Stinger
issue.body:
<!-- Lines like this one are comments and will not be shown in the final output. -->
<!-- If you are a collaborator, please add labels and assign other collaborators for a review. -->

### Describe the issue:
<!-- Replace [ ] with [x] to select options. -->
- [ X] Bug
- [ ] Change request
- [ ] New feature request
- [ ] Discussion request

### Issue long description:
Tried to download from a Suunto Stinger using a third-party usb interface adapter.
The adapter is recognised but no dives are listed or downloaded.

### Operating system:
Android 13
Moto  Edge 30 Fusion

### Subsurface version:
3.4.7 (5.0.9.35)
Official release

### Steps to reproduce:
Plug in usb adapter it is recognised.
Put Stinger into Transfer-PC mode.
Open Subsurface and the Suunto Stinger can be selected in the dropdown menus.
 
### Current behavior:
Initiate the download but no dives are listed.
They cannot be downloaded.
Eventually the Stinger times-out.

### Expected behavior:
Iit should list the dives as  normal so they can be downloaded.

### Additional information:
<!-- If a simple dive log file can reproduce the issue, please attach that to the report. -->
<!-- With dive computer download issues consider adding Subsurface log file and Subsurface dumpfile to the report. -->

### Mentions:
<!-- Mention users that you want to review your issue with @<user-name>. Leave empty if not sure. -->

comment.body: A lot of things could be causing this. The USB serial chip in the cable could be unsupported by the user space drivers we use on Android, there could be connector issues (those seem very common with early Suuntos), the battery could be too low (the required voltage for successful data download is higher than that for it to turn on / appear to function during a dive). Etc.

commits.message:
Desktop: Simplify the get_dive_gas() function.

Remove branches that are always taken or make no difference, as proposed in
https://github.com/subsurface/subsurface/pull/3974#pullrequestreview-1674178375.

Signed-off-by: Michael Keller <github@ike.ch>

issue.title: Media not shown on dive profile if no "real dive computer" was used
issue.body:
<!-- Lines like this one are comments and will not be shown in the final output. -->
<!-- If you are a collaborator, please add labels and assign other collaborators for a review. -->

### Describe the issue:
<!-- Replace [ ] with [x] to select options. -->
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Change request
- [ ] New feature request
- [ ] Discussion request

### Issue long description:
I just noticed that in my newer dives, media (photo thumbnails) are not shown on the dive profile despite of them being available and mapped correctly. Adding a new dive manually and importing the media from a local disk, they are shown on the graph immediately after importing them – but as soon as I switch to another dive and return they are gone from the profile, while remaining in the media tab (e.g. similar to what is described in #2833 – with the difference that for me they never show up again in the profile even if I toggle all the buttons).

Scrolling through my dives to older ones I saw media are shown for those (dives 92 and before with the attached XML). Looking for the difference I noticed they are shown for all dives where data from a "real dive computer" exist (I had one once but it broke) – but for none of the others.

### Operating system:
* OS: Linux Mint 20.3
* desktop PC (no DC anymore, data entered manually, never imported from a DC before as mine was broken before I started with Subsurface)
* cannot test on another OS as I run only Linux

### Subsurface version:
* Subsurface 0.5.10 (latest AppImage)
* not tested on another version (if you let me know which I shall test, I can take a look)
* official release (AppImage downloaded [from the official place](https://subsurface.github.io/download/))

### Steps to reproduce:
1. manually add a dive and fill in the details
2. go to the media tab, right click, selecting files from local disk which fit into the time frame of the dive (my ActionCam has the correct time set)
3. see their thumbs showing up in the tab and as well on the profile graph
4. switch to any other dive previously imported/added
5. switch back to the new dive: media still in the tab, but no longer in the profile graph.

### Current behavior:
Media disappear from the profile graph after having shown up correctly mapped at the initial import.

### Expected behavior:
Media showing up in the profile graph every time the corresponding dive record is selected

### Additional information:
Here's my XML file (extracted around 1 MB) zipped: [xml.zip](https://github.com/subsurface/subsurface/files/13034607/xml.zip). I can reproduce the issue every single time I open it with Subsurface.

### Mentions:
<!-- Mention users that you want to review your issue with @<user-name>. Leave empty if not sure. -->

repo.name: subsurface
repo.description: This is the official upstream of the Subsurface divelog program

repo.name: subsurface
repo.description: This is the official upstream of the Subsurface divelog program

commits.message:
Ignore oxygen cylinders in get_dive_gas

It looks kinda strange that all CCR dives have a dive gas ..100%, so
rather than showing it as the dive gas used, just ignore cylinders
with usage flagged as oxygen.

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

Ignore not used cylinders in get_dive_gas

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

Correctly find min o2 in get_dive_gas

When the import from a dive computer gives you 100% as the first gas,
the get_dive_gas never finds which gas had the lowest o2 percent.

This fixes the logic to find the lowest o2 percent in any dive cylinder
list.

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

Add tests for formatDiveGasString

This adds tests for formatDiveGasString to ensure it produces the
expected results in some scenarios.

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

Add even more tests for formatDiveGasString

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

Remove unnecessary QString

I thought it would solve the unicode issues I had, but it was
unnecessary.

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

Correctly update mino2

When we've already seen a trimix gas, of we after that see a nitrox gas
with less o2, it shouldn't update the mino2 state.

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

Add another test for formatDiveGasString

This adds a test for the bug just fixed, where we have a trimix gas and
nitrox/air with less o2 than the trimix.

Signed-off-by: Anton Lundin <glance@ac2.se>

comment.body:
Yes, it's a description of the actual gases carried during the dive.

Yes, it looked like you found another case where the previous code had a bug. I fixed that and included the test case.

comment.body:
From logcat: ` 6707 10-17 23:46:03.840   466   466 E AndroidRuntime: java.lang.SecurityException: Permission Denial: starting Intent { act=android.intent.action.MAIN cat=[android.intent.category.LAUNCHER] flg=0x10000000 pkg=org.subsurfac      edivelog.mobile cmp=org.subsurfacedivelog.mobile/.SubsurfaceMobileActivity } from ProcessRecord{f235a57 466:com.android.vending/u0a161} (pid=466, uid=10161) not exported from uid 10477`

Looks like you'd need to set `android:exported` to true for the main activity? https://developer.android.com/privacy-and-security/risks/android-exported#:~:text=The%20android%3Aexported%20attribute%20sets,by%20its%20exact%20class%20name.

comment.body:
I have exactly the same issue.

To fill out the requested information:

### Describe the issue:
<!-- Replace [ ] with [x] to select options. -->
- [x ] Bug
- [ ] Change request
- [ ] New feature request
- [ ] Discussion request

### Issue long description:
Using a freshly installed version of Subsurface Android (in the beta channel), I open the app. It briefly displays the starting logo and then terminates.

It does work with an older version.

### Operating system:
OS: Android 14, UP1A.231105.002 - en_US
Device: Google Pixel 7 Pro

### Subsurface version:
Broken: Version: 3.4.8(5.0.10.177) - official version in beta channel

Working: Version Subsurface-mobile-4.9.9.0-arm64.apk from homepage works for me

### Steps to reproduce:
Install  beta-version from playstore, try starting.

### Current behavior:
Displays start screen and crashes


### Mentions:
@mikeller I provided the requested information.
